headline: This week’s cover

children.data: Ukraine, our worldwide cover reflects on the country’s future. It considers what victory will look like and what it requires.
How to win the hot war and the cold war that will follow it
The war is making Ukraine a Western country
The invasion has stalled, but Putin’s war on dissent marches on
The West is struggling to forge a new arsenal of democracy
Ukraine’s fate will determine the West’s authority in the world
The desperate uncertainty of Ukrainian refugees
For subscribers only: to see how we design each week’s cover, sign up to our weekly

bodyText:
oNE YEAR after the fighting started in   Ukraine, our worldwide cover reflects on the country’s future. It considers what victory will look like and what it requires.

Leaders: How to win the hot war and the cold war that will follow it
Briefing: The war is making Ukraine a Western country
Briefing: The invasion has stalled, but Putin’s war on dissent marches on
Briefing: The West is struggling to forge a new arsenal of democracy
Briefing: Ukraine’s fate will determine the West’s authority in the world
International:  The desperate uncertainty of Ukrainian refugees
For subscribers only: to see how we design each week’s cover, sign up to our weekly Cover Story newsletter.

parts.headline: This week’s covers
parts.description: How we saw the world

parts.headline: This week’s cover
parts.description: How we saw the world

parts.headline: How to win the hot war in Ukraine and the cold war that will follow it
parts.description: After a year of fighting, what comes next?

parts.headline: A year after he promised a transformation, Olaf Scholz has done too little
parts.description: Energy policy has radically altered; defence, much less so

parts.headline: Joe Biden’s new border policies irritate the extremes. Good
parts.description: They mix toughness with generosity and are a step in the right direction

parts.headline: South Africa’s diplomatic descent
parts.description: Cosying up to Russia and China harms South Africa, and the world

parts.headline: China has not resolved its past lending mistakes. But it is learning from them
parts.description: How to speed up debt-relief talks

parts.headline: Letters to the editor
parts.subheadline: On South Korea and Ukraine, ChatGPT, corruption in Britain, Moldova, Bolivia, etymologies
parts.description: A selection of correspondence
